instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
Customers board not turning on. No corrosion evident.
Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and seemed to fix but trackpad cursor had jerkiness.
Very quickly went bad again.

The 68k ohm sparkitecture resistor was not 68kohm so I replaced it with 68kohm and some changes occurred.
Green light would come on momentarily but then extinguish. Sometimes for longer and fans would spin up for a second then stop, then repeat.

Now dead with no green light.
pp3v42 0v (40k ohm to ground so no short)
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_CONN_R</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.56v
Resistance seen by charger 63kohms
charger no load 0.6v (both my 60W and 85W chargers show same 0.6v)

Is the pp3v42 power supply supposed to start with 0.6v ?
Need help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
Did you test with fake charger, or lab PSU?
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> voltages.
I bet for input leakage detected by charger.
Check <DIODE>D6910</DIODE>.
Post <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86 values; measured onboard, ohm scale.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
I was using genuine chargers but good idea to try lab psu.
Lab PSU at 16.6v gets orange light and fans did spin but not for long. Now dead again.
Orange light stays on when plug charger

pp3v42 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_S5_CHGR</SIGNAL> 16.42v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE_DIV</SIGNAL> 15.68 so left side of <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> should be conducting yet <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_DRAINS</SIGNAL> is 1.77v LOOKS WRONG

<TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR>
pin 1,2,3 16.42
pin4 6.73v
pin5,6,7,8 16.42v

<DIODE>D6910</DIODE> 0.74v diode mode
Trust you mean <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81  99k/62k
Trust you mean <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86  500!!!/330k
With <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> removed I measured 0.7k on its pads

Question: When powering up is it a common sign to see the odd
bubble or puff of smoke from underneath a component you may have covered in flux or soaked with IPA and not dried out thoroughly enough before powering up? Or is it always a component taking too much current and getting damaged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
Right away but just found ... I put a new <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> in and Im now getting fanspin but only with lab PSU. 2 genuine charger 60W/85W wont start it.
Shall I get those voltage when on genuine charger without fanspin?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message: Only if genuine charger sends DCIN voltage to MLB...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
Current situation is I get fanspin with LAB PSU only. On connection initially get green light but quickly changes to orange.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has an 800mV ripple but does average 12.6v

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> voltages when fanspin with Lab PSU.
PIn voltage
1 0
2 15.8
3 3.8
9 0
12 3.4
13 3.4
14 3.4
15 0
17 12.5
19 5.5
20 5.5
27 0.3

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
"27 0.3"
Are you sure about this?
If yes, change <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>; also check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7021</CAPACITOR>/22 not shorted to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
Yes double checked the 0.3v on pin 27

I changed <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 yesterday as 7021 looked ugly before (lumpy) so if they have gone wrong there is something else causing it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
"Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7021</CAPACITOR>/22 not shorted to ground."
Also check traces continuity...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message: I took off all the feedback components <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/21/22 and <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 and found one trace had 2.7kohm to ground. All reassembled, test tomorrow, need sleep. Thanks for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message: Well I seem to have <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and its current sensing working reliably now and pin 27 is at 14.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message:
Resistance between pins 27/28 now?
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> still not present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> replacement
threads.message: Resistance between pins 27/28 is now 20.6ohms and I have fanspin. Happy man.
